pageContext.claim: “It was the Great Tariff Debate of 1888, and the debate was we didn't know what to do with all the money we were making. We were so rich.”
pageContext.analysis: This is somewhat off. The 1888 debate was not about how to spend money so much as how to avoid running a persistent budget surplus, which at the time was caused by high revenue from tariffs. Democrats called for lower tariffs and Republicans pushed for higher ones. The Republicans won the election and increased tariffs, but Americans were not happy with the sharp increase in prices and the party lost its majority in 1890. Tariffs were reduced in 1894.
